contentList.content: MCM is 'inactive' in your load order. Make sure you have SE and saved + exported your load order. Issues may stem from using the in-game mod manager or mods with invalid UUIDs. Use BG3MM 1.0.12.8+ to identify load order problems. This message WON'T appear if MCM is active.
Reposition window if out of bounds
Automatically reposition the MCM window if it goes outside the screen boundaries.
Open the MCM window when the game starts.

The keybinding for toggling MCM's window.
Alternatively, use the MCM button in the ESC menu.

Used mainly to determine which messages to print.
Useful for developers or general troubleshooting.

Welcome to Baldur's Gate 3 Mod Configuration Menu!
If you don't see any mods here, you might need to load a save file first.
If you still don't see any mods, make sure you have mods that use MCM.

By default, you can press Insert to toggle this menu while it is unfocused.
Make the MCM window more transparent while interacting with game elements.
Allow only the host to change settings in multiplayer games.
If disabled, the window might require scrolling. You'll be able to resize the window manually by dragging the bottom-right corner.
This tab might have content that is not available in the main menu.

Print deprecation warnings for mods with outdated code.
They will still be printed if developer mode is enabled (logic OR).
Check to enable the list, uncheck to disable it, without removing/disabling any elements.
Are you sure you want to delete all elements?
Click, input a page number and press enter to navigate to it
Reset this list to its default elements
Delete all elements from the list
Are you sure you want to reset the list to its default elements?
Reset this setting to its default ([1])
Don't see the MCM window? Check the troubleshooting steps on the mod page.
Press keys to assign | [ESC] to cancel, [BACKSPACE] to unassign
Click to assign a new key combination.
Keybinding [1] for action '[2]' conflicts with action '[3]'.
Script Extender's (SE) IMGUI implementation is in constant development. If you're having issues:
If crashing under Vulkan, test without IMGUI mods like MCM
Verify the problem persists with no other DLL mods
Ensure you're using the latest BG3 version and SE Release version
Provide SE console logs - you can easily enable the SE console via BG3MM preferences
Describe behavior under DirectX 11 and Vulkan
Upload crash reports if prompted by the SE
UI not showing up: test both Vulkan and DirectX 11
With MCM, you can configure the settings of mods that use MCM.
To get started, click a mod from the list on the left.
All settings are saved automatically as you make changes.
To reset a setting, click the reset button next to it.
You can control + click a slider to type in a specific value.
MCM uses IMGUI, which is a library also used by ReShade and other mods.
For more information, visit the MCM page on Nexus.
MCM is a centralized configuration menu for Baldur's Gate 3 mods, allowing easy management of mod settings.
It is designed to be user-friendly and accessible, providing a consistent interface for mod configuration.
It was the culmination of months of work done by mostly a single developer. If you find it useful, please consider endorsing it on Nexus Mods and dropping a donation.
BG3MCM's code is licensed under AGPLv3. For details, refer to the GitHub link in the mod description.

BG3MCM incorporates code from the Compatibility Framework, BG3ModManager, and Volition Cabinet, all of which are licensed under the MIT License. Additionally, BG3SE is licensed under the MIT License with an added Commons Clause. Open Dyslexic and Inter fonts are licensed under the SIL-OFL. Copies of these licenses are included in the appropriate sections of this mod's code.
Mod authors and translators may enable donation points for any mods using this framework as a dependency, and may freely use examples provided to help build integration with this mod.
The licensing terms on Nexus complement these permissions. In cases of overlap, the stricter of the two licensing terms should apply.

I extend my gratitude to Norbyte, LaughingLeader, Focus and the CL team for making their code available under such open and permissive licenses, enabling seamless collaboration across the modding community!
For more details, visit the MCM page on Nexus.
CTRL + click to input value manually.
Reinitializes the server and client Lua VM.

Keybinding [1] is bound to multiple actions.
Open MCM and rebind conflicting keys.

Should this keybinding be enabled?
Disabling it will prevent it from firing if the keybinding is pressed.
Set the keybinding for closing MCM's window.
When enabled, the sidebar will automatically collapse based on inactivity or other collapse triggers (opening a mod page, etc).
Enable hover-based expansion of the sidebar when hovering the hamburger menu icon.
Wrong No Press Any Key Menu version

You're using 'No Press Any Key Menu' without the MCM compatibility patch.
Your main menu may not display the MCM button correctly.

Please replace it with the patched version from Caites' mod page.

Mod '[1]' has an invalid UUID ([2]).
This mod may cause your load order to reset.
Delete the pak file for this mod or look for an update.
You may downgrade to Patch 6 or 7 and use Mod Uninstaller to try to remove this mod if you can't load a save without this mod.
Your load order has a mod with an invalid UUID ([1] [2])

Can't check dependency '[1]' for mod '[2]' because it has no version information.
This doesn't impact functionality, but please contact [3] to update the meta.lsx file for '[4]'.
The version node might have an outdated ID (it should be Version64).

Mod '[1]' requires '[2]' version [3] or higher, but loaded version is [4].
Please update [2].

Mod '[1]' requires dependency '[2]', which is not loaded.
Please install [2].

Mod '[1]' declares a conflict with mod '[2]', but '[2]' is loaded.
Please resolve this conflict by disabling one of them, or look for compatibility patches.

Hide the sidebar.
You can also toggle it with [1].

Expand the sidebar containing keybindings, mods, etc.
You can also toggle it with [1].
Detach mod content to a separate window
When opening MCM (after loading a save), automatically restore the last used mod page.
When a mod page is opened, automatically restore the last used subtab for that mod.

If you don't see the MCM window, please see the mod page for troubleshooting steps.
This is usually caused by third-party overlays or by alt-tabbing before reaching the main menu.
You may also try deleting imgui.ini inside the game's folder.

Changes the size of text displayed in the MCM window.
NOTE: Icons will only have correct scale after changing font size if you reload a save.
Set the font size for the MCM interface.
Start with the sidebar in a collapsed state when opening MCM.
Toggles the sidebar between collapsed and expanded.
Provides an in-game UI that enables players to intuitively manage mod settings and hotkeys.
Toggle detached windows with main window
When toggling the MCM window, also toggle the visibility of any detached mod pages.

By default, the sidebar automatically expands when hovering the menu icon, and will collapse when opening a mod page.
You can also manually toggle it with [1].
Profile changes require a reload to take effect.
Connecting players cannot use this page. Only the host may change these settings.
Enable or disable specific log types. These settings work in conjunction with the debug level to determine which messages are displayed.

Mod '[1]' uses MCM but is loaded before MCM itself.
This may cause issues.
Please move '[2]' after MCM in your load order.
Load order precedence: load MCM before '[1]'
Warns if any mod in the load order has an invalid or missing UUID.
Warns if there are missing or outdated load order dependencies.
Warns if incompatible No Press Any Key Menu version is detected in the load order.
Warns if there are mod conflicts in the load order.
Warns if MCM is not placed before dependent mods in the load order.

MCM will scan your load order for potential issues and display visual warnings in the main menu if any are found.
It is recommended to keep all checks enabled. Most of these issues would cause problems for some of your mods.
Warnings can be disabled in an individual basis as they appear.
Are you sure you want to proceed?
Photo Mode Camera Toggle Mouse Rotate
Photo Mode Camera Rotate Mouse Right
Photo Mode Camera Rotate Mouse Left
Photo Mode Camera Rotate Mouse Up
Photo Mode Camera Rotate Mouse Down
Photo Mode Camera Rotate Up Alt
Photo Mode Camera Rotate Down Alt
Button errored. Please contact [1] about this issue.

This mod has one or more assigned hotkeys.
Click to open Hotkeys.
Vanilla/Native keybindings are read-only. This UI does not update when you change them in-game.
Right-click dropdowns to open mod settings
Text is saved when you click outside the field.
